dcm.filt module#

DICOM data filtering

Classes:

DataCollection

Collection of dicom data that can include inconsistent/duplicate data

DataTransform

Transforms data, and keeps track so it can be reversed

DummyTransform

Dummy transform for efficiently handling no-op

Filter

Callable for modifying data sets with info about its read/write needs

FilterTransform

Data transform described by Filter

MultiFilter

MultiFilter(filters: 'Tuple[Filter, ...]', read_elems: 'FrozenLazySet[str]' = <factory>, write_elems: 'FrozenLazySet[str]' = <factory>, invertible_elems: 'FrozenLazySet[str]' = <factory>)

MultiSelector

Logically combine selectors for more complex selections

Selector

Abstract base for objects that can select/reject data sets

SingleSelector

Define a selection based on a single attribute

Functions:

Bases: object

Collection of dicom data that can include inconsistent/duplicate data

Methods:

__init__(qr[, inconsistent, duplicate])

Attributes:

duplicate

List of data sets that are duplicates of those in qr

inconsistent

List of data sets that can't be stored in qr due to inconsistancy

qr

Captures all the consistent non-duplicate data

List of data sets that are duplicates of those in qr

List of data sets that can’t be stored in qr due to inconsistancy

qr: QueryResult#

Captures all the consistent non-duplicate data

class dcm.filt.DataTransform[source]#

Bases: object

Transforms data, and keeps track so it can be reversed

Abstract base class. All subclasses should have two QueryResult attributes old and new (which should be treated as read-only) plus the methods below.

Methods:

add(old_ds, new_ds)

Add pre/post transformed data set

reverse(new_qr)

Invert the transformation for some subset of the new QueryResult

Attributes:

new

Post-transform data

old

Pre-transform data
add(old_ds, new_ds)[source]#

Add pre/post transformed data set

Will raise InconsistentDataError or DuplicateDataError based on the post-filtering data

Parameters:

  • old_ds (Dataset) –

  • new_ds (Dataset) –

Return type:

None

reverse(new_qr)[source]#

Invert the transformation for some subset of the new QueryResult

Returns a DataCollection.

Parameters:

new_qr (QueryResult) –

Return type:

DataCollection

new: QueryResult#

Post-transform data

old: QueryResult#

Pre-transform data

class dcm.filt.Filter[source]#

Bases: _BaseFilter, _SingleFilter

Callable for modifying data sets with info about its read/write needs

By default it is assumed the filter needs access to the full data set and can modify any element in any way. More info can be provided by setting the various *_elems attributes which will allow for various optimizations.

Methods:

__init__(func[, read_elems, write_elems, ...])

get_dependencies(elems)

Attributes:

__init__(func, read_elems=<factory>, write_elems=<factory>, invertible_elems=<factory>)#
Parameters:

  • func (Callable[[Dataset], Optional[Dataset]]) –

  • read_elems (FrozenLazySet[str]) –

  • write_elems (FrozenLazySet[str]) –

  • invertible_elems (FrozenLazySet[str]) –

Return type:

None

get_dependencies(elems)[source]#
Parameters:

elems (Any) –

Return type:

Tuple[List[Callable[[Dataset], Optional[Dataset]]], FrozenLazySet[str]]

func: Callable[[Dataset], Optional[Dataset]]#

A function that takes a DICOM data set and can return a modified version, or None to signify the data should be skipped

invertible_elems: FrozenLazySet[str]#

Elements where values are only modified in isolated/deterministic way

The same input value for these elements should always get the same output value.

read_elems: FrozenLazySet[str]#

Elements the function needs to read to make any modifications

write_elems: FrozenLazySet[str]#

Elements that might be modified by the function

reverse(new_qr)[source]#

Invert the remapping for some subset of the new QueryResult

Returns a DataCollection so we can also capture data that was duplicate or inconsistent prior to filtering (and thus can’t be included in a QueryResult)

Parameters:

new_qr (QueryResult) –

Return type:

DataCollection

fixed_duplicates: Dict[str, Dataset]#
fixed_inconsistent: Dict[str, Dataset]#

Post-transform data

old: QueryResult#

Pre-transform data

dcm.filt.make_edit_filter(edit_dict, update_uids=True, uid_prefix='2.25', add_uid_entropy=None)[source]#

Make a Filter that edits some DICOM attributes

Parameters:

  • edit_dict (dict) – Maps keywords to new values (or None to delete the element)

  • update_uids (bool) – Set to False to avoid automatically updating UID values

  • add_uid_entropy (list or None) – One or more strings used as “entropy” when remapping UIDs

  • uid_prefix (str) –

Return type:

_BaseFilter

dcm.filt.make_reject_filter(reject_dict)[source]#

Make a filter that rejects certain datasets

This is useful when you want to limit a transfer based on attributes that can’t be queried for.

Parameters:

reject_dict (Dict[str, Tuple[Callable[[Dataset, Dataset], Any], Any]]) – Maps keywords to (operator, rvalue) tuples defining which datasets to reject

Return type:

_BaseFilter

dcm.filt.make_uid_update_cb(uid_prefix='2.25', add_uid_entropy=None)[source]#
Parameters:

  • uid_prefix (str) –

  • add_uid_entropy (Optional[List[Any]]) –

Return type:

Callable[[Dataset, DataElement], None]
